qas.question: Why do students think people should be allowed to eat or drink on subways ?

paragraphs.context: People shouldn't be allowed to eat or drink in subways  Recently in many cities, passengers are not allowed to eat or drink on subways, or they will be fined. Should foods and drinks be accepted on subways? Many students show different opinions.   However, other students disagree. They think that some passengers bring food and drinks to the subways, and throw rubbish everywhere. It smells terrible and make people uncomfortable.   In my opinion, I think it's not necessary to do this as long as passengers follow the rule, everyone should try their best to build a clean and healthy public environment.

qas.question: What 's my favorite story about ?

answers.text: Practice makes perfect.  Although Chen Yaozi was a civil official in Song Dynasty, he loved archery very much, and was pretty good at it.  One day he was practicing in his own field, and eight or nine times out of ten he hit the target. He became quite complacent.  Looking around, he found an old man who sells oil standingnearby. And the old man only nodded slightly towards his skills, not amazed. Angered by this, he called the old man to come over and asked him, "Do you also know archery? Aren't my skills brilliant? " The old man took out a gourd from the wicker-basket and placed it on the ground. He covered the opening of the gourd with a copper coin. And then he scooped a spoon of oil and began to pour the oil into the gourd through the hole in the coin drop by drop without wetting the coin. The old man said to Chen Yaozi, "This is only practice makes perfect, nothing so brilliant." Chen Yaozi laughed and sent him aw

paragraphs.context: Here are some of my favorite traditional stories. Practice makes perfect.  Although Chen Yaozi was a civil official in Song Dynasty, he loved archery very much, and was pretty good at it.  One day he was practicing in his own field, and eight or nine times out of ten he hit the target. He became quite complacent.  Looking around, he found an old man who sells oil standingnearby. And the old man only nodded slightly towards his skills, not amazed. Angered by this, he called the old man to come over and asked him, "Do you also know archery? Aren't my skills brilliant? " The old man took out a gourd from the wicker-basket and placed it on the ground. He covered the opening of the gourd with a copper coin. And then he scooped a spoon of oil and began to pour the oil into the gourd through the hole in the coin drop by drop without wetting the coin. The old man said to Chen Yaozi, "This is only practice makes perfect, nothing so brilliant." Chen Yaozi laughed and sent him away.

Fourth, try to be happy, because happiness is important for our health, it's the best medicine. Finally, we must go to see a doctor when we get ill. If we try our best, we will be very healthy.

qas.question: What happened when Dad opened the box ?

paragraphs.context: Dad put the box on the ground and opened the top.   A few weeks later, the boy arrived home from university. He had missed Poppy and was looking forward to seeing her. When he bent down to give her a big hug, he fell over in surprise as a small golden cloud came racing up to lick his face too. "Oh my gosh, who is this? " he exclaimed. His parents laughed at the look of shock on his face. "That's Pee-wee, "said Dad. "I can't believe you got yourselves a puppy!" "We didn't, " replied Mom. " This puppy is for Poppy!"

qas.question: What happened a few weeks later ?

qas.question: Why is there water pollution ?

paragraphs.context: Everybody knows that there is serious problem of water pollution on the earth.   With the development of modern agriculture and industry,more and more waste water is being poured into rivers. It has caused serious water pollution. The river is becoming sodirty that noliving things can live in it. Water is important to all living things. Man cannot live without water. If we keep on polluting water, there will be no clean water for humans to use. And we may have no clean food to eat as well.  To deal withthis problem, we should work together to save water, and our government should set up laws to punish those factories which continue polluting the water. We should pay more attentionto it and try to control the water pollutionas early as possible.

qas.question: What is Li Hua doing now ?

qas.question: What did I do last weekend ?

paragraphs.context: Our Trip to the Great Wall .  Early on Saturday morning, we got on the bus happily. Everyone was excited, discussing what we had known about the Great Wall, including anecdotes and legends. Two hours later we got to our destination, and everyone couldn't wait to start climbing. We spent the next few hours on the Great Wall, stopping from time to time to take photos and appreciate its magnificence as well as the breathtaking scenery around it. Then we went to the Great Wall Museum nearby. It contains exhibitions showing the history of the Great Wall and the social landscape along it, from which we got a better understanding of the Great Wall. Time passed quickly! It was noon before we knew it. Before leaving, we took a group selfie to record this unforgettable moment. Excitement was written on everyone's face.  It was really an impressive trip and I really felt proud of this world wonder

qas.question: Why did my class organize a team mountain - climbing activity ?

paragraphs.context: Our Team Mountain-climbing Activity .  As the teacher announced the plan to us, we were so excited as to let out cheers. On Sunday morning, we gathered at the school gate with good preparation. Then we set out for the mountain in high spirits. After two hours' bus ride, we arrived at our destination. With great excitement, we started our climbing. All the way, we chatted and laughed, breathing the fresh air. When someone was tired and fell behind, others would come and give a hand. Finally, everyone made it to the top of the mountain. Bathed in sunshine, we enjoyed the splendid view cheerfully.  The activity benefited us a lot. Not only did it free us from the heavy school work, it also promoted the friendship among us! What a wonderful day!

paragraphs.context: Our Team Mountain-climbing Activity  In order to relax us from the study load, our class organized a team mountain-climbing activity last Sunday.  As the teacher announced the plan to us, we were so excited as to let out cheers. On Sunday morning, we gathered at the school gate with good preparation. Then we set out for the mountain in high spirits. After two hours' bus ride, we arrived at our destination. With great excitement, we started our climbing. All the way, we chatted and laughed, breathing the fresh air. When someone was tired and fell behind, others would come and give a hand. Finally, everyone made it to the top of the mountain. Bathed in sunshine, we enjoyed the splendid view cheerfully.  The activity benefited us a lot. Not only did it free us from the heavy school work, it also promoted the friendship among us! What a wonderful day!

qas.question: Why do students feel stressed ?

paragraphs.context: The senior high school entrance exam is coming, both the students and parents are under great pressure. Some students even argue with their parents. There are some reasons why both of them feel stressed. . So they need to reduce stress by watching TV, playing games or any other ways. As for their parents, they are worried about their children's grades. All of them hope that their own kid can get high scores so they ask their children to attend extra classes at the weekend.  In my opinion, as students and children, we need to understand our parents and try to communicate with them as often as possible. In addition, we can try to do something meaningful together with our parents like reading or seeing a film. In this way, our parents and us can understand each other much more than before.

qas.question: What impacts does the emergence of such lingo have on Chinese language ?

paragraphs.context: Nowadays, young people often create some new slangs to differentiate themselves.   In my opinion, it is not necessary to worry about the new slang that will likely weaken the new generation's capability of writing or remembering Chinese characters.   There are two reasons. Firstly, the purpose of language is to convey ideas and share opinions. Thus, the prevailing youth lingo, as a more concise and efficient way of expression, is in fact an enrichment of modern Chinese language. Secondly, since every era has its own young generation, the youth lingo, can be a new identity for young people, cannot pollute or extinct Chinese language but by contrast, it may become an emblem or living fossil of this specific era.  To conclude, while language development is inevitable, Chinese internet lingo is unlikely to replace the existing use of Mandarin Chinese but will be enriching it by adding a new layer or dimension to it.

qas.question: What did Jenny found when she knocked the door ?

paragraphs.context: One possible version  Approaching the doorway , Jenny took a deep breath. Tired and sad, she sat down in front of the house. "Where could my mother be? " she wondered. "Was she still angry with me? " Again, the scene of the quarrel appeared in her mind.  She remembered her rudeness to her mother. Realizing that all the scolding from her mother was due to the fact that her mother really cared a lot about her, she felt rather ashamed, and tears began to roll down her cheeks.  A gentle touch on her hair called her mind back. She raised her head and saw the familiar face of her mother. "Here you come! I've been looking for you, " she said, tired and relieved. Jenny couldn't help throwing herself into her mother's arms. " Mum, I'm so sorry and thank you for all you have done for me." She expressed her sincere apology and great gratitude. Hearing this, her mother smiled, patting her back gently.

I feel very happy that the AIDS children are not ignored and are taken good care of.

qas.question: What did I and my classmates do last weekend ?

paragraphs.context: Intangible Cultural Heritage Entering Campus    Early on Saturday morning, we arrived at school excitedly. Reading the notice giving the detailed information about the activity, we couldn't wait to explore more about the intangible cultural heritage. I went to the performance of Beijing Opera first. It was so amazing that I couldn't take my eyes off the delicate facial makeups and costumes.   At the Chinese calligraphy show, I really appreciated the charm of our traditional handwriting. Then I came to the art room to experience paper-cutting. Under the instruction of the artist, I successfully finished my works and was fascinated by the elegant patterns. We completed the activity with full harvest. On the way home we couldn't stop sharing what we had seen and learned. Everyone was excited.  This activity helps us have a better understanding of Chinese intangible cultural heritage. It entered our campus and stays in our hearts.

qas.question: What is my favorite festival ?

paragraphs.context: My Favorite Festival    The Spring Festival falls on the 1st day of the 1st lunar month. Several days before the new year, we begin to prepare for it. My parents buy meat, fish and vegetables. Houses are cleaned up.   On the eve of the new year, the whole family get together and have a big dinner. After the meal we watch "the Spring Evening" on TV until twelve o'clock. On the first day of the new year, each of us is dressed in new clothes. When meeting others outside, we say "Happy New Year" to each other.   We pay new year calls to friends and relatives. That day my parents and relatives give "Red-bags" （money） to us children. All of us have a great time. That's why I like Spring Festival.

qas.question: What did the gift card read ?

paragraphs.context: He said, "I've been looking for you for twenty-five years." He handed me a bulging red stocking at that night, winked, and left. On top of the stocking was a gift card.   I later discovered that the older man was her father.   Jill had seen the hurt little girl underneath the thirty-something woman and decided to do something about it.  So now I believe that Santa is real. I don't mean the twinkle-eyed character of children's mythology or the creation of American holiday marketers. Those Santas annoy and sadden me. I believe in the Santa Claus that live inside good and thoughtful people.   This Santa does not return to the North Pole after a crazy delivery in an empty sock but lives each day purposefully, really listens to friends, and then plans deliberate acts of kindness. The Christmas memories will be wonderful.

I don't mean the twinkle-eyed character of children's mythology or the creation of American holiday marketers. Those Santas annoy and sadden me. I believe in the Santa Claus that live inside good and thoughtful people.   This Santa does not return to the North Pole after a crazy delivery in an empty sock but lives each day purposefully, really listens to friends, and then plans deliberate acts of kindness. The Christmas memories will be wonderful.

qas.question: What ’s my opinion about friendship ?

paragraphs.context: As students，we can share more time with our friends. I often feel very lucky to have a lot of good friends, especially when I have Jim as one of my best friends. We have shared happiness and sorrows with each other since we were classmates at primary school. And we help each other with our study.  What if our friendship is troubled? First，we should never let our pride get in our way. Most of us can forgive each other when differences are brought out in the open. Second，apologize when we're wrong-even if we've been wronged. What's more, see things from our friends' point of view. Last but not least，accept that friendships change as our needs and lifestyles change.

qas.question: What are people 's attitudes towards making mistakes ?

paragraphs.context: We human beings, are not always correct in our life. It is normal for us to make mistakes at one time of another.  Despite the fact that we all make mistakes, what counts most is the altitudes towards them, which vary from person to person..   In my opinion, there is no shame in making mistakes.   What we need to do is to recognize out mistakes and learn from them. Take Thomas Edison for example, he made many mistakes and experienced lots of failure while experimenting with different materials for the light bulb. But he was brave enough to face up to them and accumulated some beneficial experience. Eventually, he succeeded in finding the most suitable material. From this example, we can learn that no one is perfect and leaning from mistakes can make us wiser that before.

If you are in outdoor, you must run as fast as you can to a open space. However, if you are trapped, after you calm down, you should pull yourself through the dark and shout for help.  If we follow these steps, we might be saved in an earthquake.

First, Don't speak loudly in public, especially in the library. Speaking loudly in public means being rude. Second, be patient while waiting in a line to get on the bus or get in the places of interest. Remember, a welcome visitor never jumps the queue. Third, throw the rubbish into the rubbish can. Fourth, don't spit on the floor. A welcome visitor will take a plastic bag with him or her so that he or she can throw rubbish into it when there is no rubbish can in sight as well as spit into the bag.   In a word, we need to be polite, obey rules and keep the environment clean while travelling. In this way, we will be welcome visitors.

qas.question: What day was it last Friday ?

Quickly we checked the old man and decided to give him the first aid. Wang Wei bent over and did CPR for him and I called an ambulance at the same time.   Very soon, the ambulance came. Holding a leaf in hand, I casually exchanged anecdotes with my parents, feeling the relaxation that I had been missing for a long time.  After lunch, we went rock climbing. Though the wall was high and steep, I was determined to conquer it. With my parents' encouragement, I eventually managed to reach the top. At that moment, my confidence was restored.  On Monday morning, my parents saw me off at the school gate. Their warm smiles and raised thumbs filled me with energy. I waved them goodbye and promised to devote myself to the preparation for Gaokao. This weekend would go a long way with me as it was a new starting point, from which I believe I could go far.

qas.question: What ’s the benefits of Traditional Chinese Medicine ?

answers.text: TCM therapies have many benefits. Usually there are natural treatments such as Gua Sha, acupuncture and massage, by which patients can be completely cured without the use of drugs. qas.question: What 's the physical situation of students through the survey ?

paragraphs.context: A survey was recently conducted to evaluate our students' physical fitness.   The major factors that have contributed to the phenomenon mentioned before may be summarized as follows. Absence of proper physical exercise and lack of a balanced diet result in the problem of weight As for the near-sighted problem the large amount of homework and over use of electronic device account for it.  It is high time for us to take appropriate measures to end this trend. First, the students should develop good habits, such as making sure to exercise regularly and avoid junk food, thus improving their physical fitness. In addition, more importance should be attached to protecting eyesight, such as doing eye exercises every day and limiting the time of using smart phones.

qas.question: What‘s my favorite animal ?

paragraphs.context: My favorite animal  I love dogs. I also love their wild relatives, coyotes and wolves. The reason why I love dogs so much is that they are loyal and they are man's best friend. He has four legs and a small face. He loves meat very much. There is a bowl near his house. There are always some bones or pork in it. And it is always very clean. His house is very beautiful. The door is red. And there are two windows in the wall. The wall is white and pink. There is a lock in the door. The lock is yellow. It is very nice. Ice loves his house very much. He usually sleeps and rests in it.

qas.question: What has caused many health problems for teenagers ?

paragraphs.context: Personally, eating too much fast food may account for teenage obesity. And lack of exercise may be another reason. As we all know it is very important to keep healthy. But do you know how to keep healthy? In my opinion, the best way to keep healthy is to have a balanced diet with more fruit and vegetables. Meanwhile, we should say goodbye to junk food and snacks. What's more, doing exercise regularly is also a good choice. Instead of spending too much time lying on our sofas or in beds, we should try to do more sports, such as swimming, skating, running and playing basketball.  In a word, having a good diet and exercising will surely benefit our health!

qas.question: When and where did the accident happened ?

paragraphs.context: I was taking a walk along Park Road. I saw an old man coming out of the park. Just then a blue car drove down Third Street and made a right turn into Park Road. The next moment the car hit the old man while he was crossing the road. He fell down with a cry. The car didn't stop but drove off at a great speed heading west. I noticed the driver was a young woman and the plate number was AC864.   About two minutes later I stopped a passing car and took the old man to the nearest hospital.  Zhang Tong

paragraphs.context: Hi! Anna,   I'm glad to hear from you..  I joined the relay race on the sports meeting last year. I was the third runner. Although I could run very fast, it was still difficult for me not to drop the stick. So before the race, my team members practiced with me again and again after school every day. They were patient to teach me the skill and tell me not to be nervous. It was their company and encouragement that helped me learn how to take the stick and pass it on very well. Finally, we won.  All of us were happy and excited to win. Moreover, we realize the importance of teamwork. We know that working together and helping each other make our team strong and help us to succeed.  Yours,  Li Hua

qas.question: Can I describe this picture briefly ?

paragraphs.context: What the picture conveys is that we should never aim too high, neglecting the readily attainable goal. If the man stopped focusing on the distant waters and looked around, the fish near the boat would be an easy harvest for him. This is not uncommonin our daily life. When we aim to build one ridiculously large project,we complete nothing; when we aim for a small goal, we complete it. Let’s be more practical.

qas.question: What does this picture convey ?

paragraphs.context: In the picture, a man on a boat is searching for some fish with a telescope. However, his efforts do not pay off, for the net is still empty. Amusingly, a school of fish is swimming just nearby, but he completely ignores them.  This is not uncommonin our daily life. qas.question: What are the causes of the endangered wild animals ?

paragraphs.context: Protect wild animals  Wild animals are natural resources which live in the same earth with people. We are not alone in the world. We could not live without plants and animals around us. So protecting them is very important. Eating wild animals not only does not have special nutrition, but also the virus in the body of wild animals can be introduced into the human body. And eating wild animals will destroy the ecological balance, leading to the extinction of many species.  In my opinion, it is high time for us to take quick action to protect them. A national public campaign should be launched to give animals good living environment. In addition, the government should pass some firm laws to forbid abuse killing. Only in this way can we live in harmony with wild animals.

In addition, having breakfast can help you to concentrate in class and study more efficiently.

qas.question: What is the purpose of writing ?

paragraphs.context: Don't be in bad mood. For a newcomer, it's really hard to start a new life. It may take you a period of time to adapt yourself to it（）.  However, you have to face it. What's more, it may also be a good idea to help others if possible, which can show them you are warm-hearted and friendly（）. paragraphs.context: There are some people who think that going to the cinema is a better choice.  However, other people hold the view that they prefer to watch movies at home. Also watching movies at home can save time and money.  In my opinion, although the tickets are very expensive, I will go to the cinema instead of watching movies online at home. What's more the magic of silver screen is so fascinating that it cannot be replaced by other ways of watching movies.

qas.question: Why do people choose to live a low - carbon life ?

paragraphs.context: As students, we can choose to live a low-carbon life, too.   In our daily life, we should save water, electricity and paper. Remember to turn off the water tap or reuse water. We're supposed to use both sides of the paper. We ought to turn off the lights when we leave a room. We can bring our own shopping bags when we go to the supermarket. Don't buy unnecessary clothes because it is a kind of waste. Don't buy cups, bowls or chopsticks which can be used only once. If possible, we'd better go to school on foot or by bike.  Let's take action and be a low-carbon people!　  Let's take actions and be a low-carbon people!

qas.question: Where did I go last week ?

paragraphs.context: A Taste for Chinese Crosstalk .  On Friday our teacher told us that we were going to watch a crosstalk. On hearing the news, we were so excited that we jumped up and down.  Upon arrival, we got into the theatre, queuing quietly and orderly though we couldn't wait to hear it. As we got seated, the show soon started. Watching and hearing two comics' humorous dialogues on the stage, we couldn't help bursting out laughing and giving them several rounds of applause.  After the performance, we were lucky enough to discuss the crosstalk with the comics. After knowing how to reveal the jokes and the roles they had played, some of us even put on the long gowns and tried their dialogues vividly.  On the way home, every one of us was still immersed in the atmosphere we had experienced that day because not only did we have a wonderful day, but also got a chance to experience such a fantastic Chinese traditional art form in person.

qas.question: What 's the most important thing about smartphones right now ?

paragraphs.context: Nowadays, as mobile phones are becoming popular among middle-school students, they bring us both great convenience and much trouble.   First of all, mobile phones can help us a great deal when we use them to communicate, look up English words, learn news, listen to music, read e-books and even relax after a day's busy study by playing games for a while.   However, long-time using mobile phones will of course waste plenty of our study time, hurt our eyes and even make us addicted to playing games, which surely will have bad effects on our study and worry our teachers and parents badly.   In my view, only when we can use them properly and strictly but never delay our study will mobile phones become help to us.

qas.question: What is reported ?

paragraphs.context: Is it okay for parents to punish their children?   It's quite natural that people from different backgrounds may have different attitudes towards it, just as the old saying goes "Every advantage has its disadvantage. " Those who support it think that punishing children is a common education method used by parents and they can stop their children's misconduct immediately. And they also argue that moderate punishment can let children learn from it.  However, many others are against it. They argue that punishment can make a child feel disrespected and lose confidence, which does no good to children's growth. Besides, one possible consequence is that children may learn to lie in order to avoid punishment.  In my opinion, parents should focus on cultivating children's consciousness instead of punishment. What's more, parents should guide their children with correct words and deeds in their daily life. After all, parents are their children's first teachers.

paragraphs.context: Nowadays, WeChat study groups are more and more popular among people.   However, opinions on it vary. Some are for it, while others against.  From my perspective, I strongly disapprove of this idea.   First, it's easy for students to cheat when they do their homework assigned through Wechat groups. They can search for answers on the Internet any time, which takes away the point of being given homework. Second, they can play computer games in the name of doing homework, which may have a bad effect on their studies. Last but not least, studying by joining the WeChat groups is a waste of time, which should be spent more meaningfully.   In conclusion, while Wechat can bring much convenience to our life and study, I do think that assigning homework and learning through Wechat group isn't a good choice.

qas.question: What requires I to think deeply ?

paragraphs.context: What happened to Sophie reminds me of my experiences. I was once overweight and looked somewhat special. Some naughty boys called me "meatball". One of the boys even thought that I was responsible for his missing textbook. Another time, they robbed me of my new bike for two days. Because I was scared, I lied to my parents that I lost my bike.   Fortunately, my headteacher got to know this and came to my help.  Students who have been bullied for a long time are hurt in their heart. This will make them timid and affect their study.  Once bullied, the first thing we should do is to turn to the teachers instead of using violence. Besides, school regulations should be made practical to punish whoever breaks them. We can also ask help for our parents.   Only when we work together can we succeed in preventing school bullying.

qas.question: What 's the result of dramatic increasing of cars ?

paragraphs.context: Good morning, everyone, I am Li Hua from Xingguang Middle School. The topic of my speech is“Let's Ride Shared Bikes".  Therefore, it's high time we chose another better means of transport, that is, shared bikes.  There are many good reasons to ride shared bikes. First of all, compared to cars, shared bikes are much cheaper to use and you don't have all the added costs of fuel, and parking. What's more, shared bikes are more environmentally friendly than cars, because shared bikes have become a new trend around the world, a good way of energy saving and low-carbon life. Last but not least, riding shared bikes is an excellent way to keep fit and live longer. By riding shared bikes, you can cut down on your risk of heart attacks, high blood pressure and other illnesses.  So I think, riding shared bikes actually has great effects on us. Let's ride shared bikes from today on! Thank you!

qas.question: When is mid - autumn Festival ?

paragraphs.context: Good morning,   everyone!  I'm greatly honored to speak here.  Mid-autumn Festival is a popular and important lunar harvest festival celebrated by Chinese peoplr.   There are some traditions in this holiday. For example, people would have a big dinner with their families. After dinner, they often enjoy the full moon which is round and bright. The other tradition of mid-autumn festival is eating moon cake. Moon cake is the essential of that day, which means reunion. As time goes by, there are various kinds of moon cakes, but they are much more expensive than before. I like mid-autumn festival because my families will get together and have a big dinner on that day.  Thank you for listening.

qas.question: Why do some students agree that students should go abroad at that early age in our school ?

paragraphs.context: Recently, we had a discussion on whether students should go abroad at that early age in our school.   However, other students are against that. They believe that as teenagers they are too young to take good care of themselves if going abroad early, as a result, their parents will worry about them. In addition, the cost of studying and living abroad is much higher which may add too much stress on parents.  From my point of view, I'm strongly in favor of studying abroad early, for teenagers can get an opportunity to open their eyes and they can thoroughly know what they really want at an early age and then they can stick to it. At the same time, teenagers in some ways can be force to be independent as soon as possible when staying alone abroad.

qas.question: When is National Eye Care Day and why is it set ?

paragraphs.context: As we all know, eyes are the windows to the soul. We should try our best to protect them. Here are some suggestions for good eye health. 　 First, eat some food that are good for eyes, such as carrots and eggs. Second, do more eye exercises to make them relax. Also it's helpful to look far away from time to time after studying long. Finally, make sure to have a good eye habit. Don't read books or use a cell phone in bed.  　 In a word, eyes are so important that all of us should do what we can to keep them healthy.

qas.question: Who is Stephen Hawking ?

paragraphs.context: He was born on January 8, 1942 in the UK. Stephen Hawking showed great interest in science as a child. He graduated from Oxford University, and got his doctor degree in the University of Cambridge, where he worked as a professor and did some research, making great achievements.  He published many books, among which A Brief History of Time. The Universe in a Nutshell, The Grand Design are very famous. He ever visited China for three times and gave some science reports and speeches in different cities.  Stephen Hawking is an outstanding man, whose courage, talent and humour inspire the people all over the world.

qas.question: What did I feel from my experience ?

paragraphs.context: The happy thing that I have ever experienced    I was born in a poor family. My parents live a simple life. When I was 8 years old, I was in Grade 3 of primary school. I liked watching others play the piano. In fact, I liked the beautiful picture of playing the piano.   Suddenly one day, my father took me to a nice place. Later I learned that it was a piano training center, learning piano was very expensive, but my father helped me find a piano teacher. So I learned the piano from my teacher there. Three months later I played the piano to my father but I did not play well. The teacher told my father that maybe I had no gift for it. He advised my father to give up.   But my father said that if I would like to play the piano, he didn't give up. I was moved by my father's encouragement.

paragraphs.context: Here are some of our expectations for your English class.   First, we’d like to have topics in class about Western culture. Last but not least, please give us some guidance and training in our pronunciation, because we all hope to speak English fluently and clearly just as you native speakers do. Thank you very much. Looking forward to meeting you!

qas.question: Who was Martin Luther King ?

paragraphs.context: He started his college life in Boston University when he was twenty two. It was during that period of time that he got acquainted with Miss Scott, falling in love with her, and they got married in the following year.  After his graduation in 1954, he left Boston and worked as a minister, meanwhile he started his career to lead the black American rights movement. He often gave speeches in public.  In 1963, tens of thousands of black people gathered in Washington to attend his most famous speech " I have a dream". In 1964, he received the Nobel Peace Prize before he was murdered in 1968.   Since 1986, the U.S. government has observed the National Day of Martin Luther King, on the third Monday of January.

paragraphs.context: As is seen in the picture, a pig, with a pair of glasses on the nose and a book in hand, is giving some hens a lecture on how to lay more eggs, while the hens are staring at the whiteboard with doubtful expression. The simple picture conveys a profound message that we should take a skeptical attitude towards false experts and believe our professional knowledge. As we all know, hens are born to know how to lay eggs. Therefore, there is no doubt the pig is showing off before an expert, though he is dressed up like a well-educated person. In our daily life, we often meet some people who pretend to be expert in a certain field, but in fact, they know nothing, just like the pig in the picture. When these so-called experts give guidance to us, it is wise to question them first and not to accept their advice blindly. Otherwise,we may be misled. In conclusion, on our way to success, learning is a must but questioning is also necessary.

qas.question: Why should we smile when we meet something unpleasant ?

paragraphs.context: Smile is an attitude to life. We should face everything with smile.  In our life, there may be something unpleasant. For example, you fail in an exam; or another time, you are misunderstood by your friends. These things may make you feel bad. Then what will you do? Why not learn to smile? We should also learn to smile to others. It will make you communicate better with others. Smiling at others make yourself happy as well. In a word, smiling is a kind of language belonging to everyone. Let's learn to smile. I believe our world will be more wonderful and our life will be happier and happier.

qas.question: When did I celebrate the Double Ninth Festival with my family ?

paragraphs.context: A Happy Double Ninth Festival .  Before the big day, I planned to take my Grandparents to Xiangshang Park for a visit, while my parents booked flowers on line. On the early morning of the festival, my grandparents and I set out for the park. Considering their age, I accompanied them to the top of the mountain by cable car. Enjoying the beautiful scenery, we can't help taking lots of photos. When we came back home at noon, my parents had already prepared a big lunch for us. I served the dishes and all the family enjoyed the meal happily. To my grandparents'surprise, a courier delivered two bunches of flowers soon after we finished the meal. My parents and I, along with the courier, wished them a pleasant life.  Seeing the smiles on my grandparents'faces, I was glad and proud to have done something to show my love to them.

qas.question: How many seasons are there in a year ?

paragraphs.context: The four seasons  Seasons are colorful and pretty.  Spring is the most beautiful season. When spring comes, everything comes to life. Grass and trees and flowers begin to come out.   Summer is a hot season. The sun is shining, trees and crops grow fast. People who like swimming enjoy this hot season.  Autumn is a cool and busy season. Farmers are busy getting in crops. We are rich in many kinds of fruits in autumn. So people call it a harvest season.  Winter is cold. It often snows heavily. After snowing, the ground is covered with white snow. People can ski happily in the snow. So we say winter is a white season.   What beautiful seasons! We all love them.

paragraphs.context: Possible Version: Nowadays more and more people would like to be volunteers. However, our parents and we students have different ideas about it.   Some parents do not allow children to be volunteers. They think children should spend more time on study. Also, they find it impossible for children to be volunteers as they have no free time,  During the time of being volunteers, children might get hurt easily. What's more, they think, as Grade 9 students, it is not easy for them to achieve a balance between schoolwork and volunteers.   But in children's opinions, being a volunteer is great. We can devote most of our time to helping others. Moreover, we can learn a let from doing voluntary work. For example, it is a good chance for us to learn team spirit and how to get along well with others. As an old saying goes, "helping others is helping ourselves."

He said he would protect me. Then I began to swim, but I couldn't swim forward at all. It made me upset. Then my father told me how to move, how to stretch out my hands and legs.   Slowly, I could move a little. It took me about four hours to learn to swim.  I felt quite happy.  What an unforgettable thing it was!

qas.question: What has been a hot topic in the society ?

paragraphs.context: Some people cross streets without looking at the traffic lights. One of the reasons resulting in the dangerous behaviour is that many people lack awareness of traffic safety. Besides, some people are so busy that they don't want to wait for the green light．  However, it has brought danger to themselves as well as to others. So I hope something must be done to avoid traffic accidents. For example, whoever breaks the traffic rules should be punished. As middle school students, we should obey the traffic rules. It is well known that people are expected to stop when the traffic light is red while walk as it turns green, What's more, we are not allowed to play and run in the street. Additionally, we'd better invite others to join us to realize the importance of obeying traffic rules. Only in this way can we cross streets safely.

qas.question: What shapes I ?

paragraphs.context: According to the author, everyone has experienced some setbacks in life.   This is particularly true in my case. A typical case is traced back to my victory of a ping-pang final. I was, as many people thought, no match for the opponent. Though I was much burdened with pressure, I quickly sensed my rival's incompetence in ball-controlling. Finally I won.   Behind the victory were the patience and perseverance needed to overcome fear, coupled with my courage to abandon normal strategies. So, when in the face of difficulty, firstly, it is advisable to have a positive psychology, being more confident and courageous. Secondly, we'd better give serious consideration to making some practical plans and solutions.   In this way, we'll find there is no obstacle we can not get over.

qas.question: What do people usually do on the Double Ninth Festival ?

paragraphs.context: Double Ninth Festival is a traditional Chinese Festival.   As a teenager, I try my best to do what I can to be nice to the old. I often visit my grandparents on weekends and talk to them and cheer them up. I also help them with the housework. Meanwhile, I am polite to the old. When I see them on the bus, I always offer them my seat. Moreover, I volunteer to look after the old who live alone in our neighborhood. I help them carry heavy things when they need help.  I think it's very important to respect the old because they have done a lot to their family and to the country. One day, we will all be old.

qas.question: Why do Chinese people like setting off fireworks during festivals ?

paragraphs.context: As we all know, Chinese people like setting off fireworks during festivals.  Setting off fireworks produces heavy smoke and it pollutes the air seriously. Many people get hurt because of it. It may even cause big fires. So our government makes the law to forbid people to sell, buy and set off fireworks in the city center. If we do, we will be fined. Our government also encourages people to celebrate festivals using many other ways, for example, we can buy some flowers or play some beautiful music, because they are environmental.  It's our duty to protect the environment. In order to breathe fresh air, let's do together to obey the law.

qas.question: What is the most important Chinese festival of the year ?

paragraphs.context: The Spring Festival    It's the first day of the lunar year.  People are very happy in Spring Festival. They often have dinners and watch special programs on TV with the family on the Lunar New Year's Eve. On the Lunar New Year's Day, people visit their relatives and friends. Children are very happy, too. They are in new clothes, and usually get some money, which is put in a red paper envelope from elder people.   In Spring Festival, you can see a lot of traditional programs too, such as lion dancing or dragon dancing. They wish people a happy New year and a bright future. It's very interesting.

qas.question: What matters when I differ in views and have trouble with each other ?

paragraphs.context: When I have trouble with my best friend  Similar as we are to our friends, we are distinct and independent individuals. Sometimes we may differ in views and have trouble with each other..  When I have trouble with my best friend, I won't withdraw but contact him timely, figure out what has gone wrong and work out a plan to rebuild friendship. To some degree, I owe a permanent, steady and dynamic relationship to mutual understanding. Attention should be paid to similarities rather than hovering over differences if I am to cultivate our friendship. Furthermore, as I have chosen him to be an intimate friend, I should never be conquered by obstacles that are meant to test my heart and advance relationship.   To conclude, whatever trouble I have with my friends, I will reserve differences, seek common ground.

qas.question: Why is friendship an important part to my life ?

paragraphs.context: I think friendship is one of the most important parts in my life. There are some of my opinions. I don't think it's necessary for friend to be the same. My best friend is Linda. She is very different from me. She is much quieter and taller than me. She always has long hair but I like short hair. I'm good at math but Linda does well in English and Chinese. We like to do our homework together after school and we always help each other. We both like playing tennis, too. As friends, I think we should help and truly care about each other. And the most importantly, if we have friends around us, we would not feel lonely and at the same time we can learn how to get on well with others. In a word, friends are important for us. Take my experience for example. Last time, I told my parents about my summer travel plan after the high school entrance examination and they simply said "No". I was really upset at first. But later, I realized that they were just worried about my safety. So I talked to them later and made it clear that I would be safe together with my classmates. In the end, not only did they agree to my plan but they also helped me prepare for the trip.  How nice it is that our parents and we can understand each other!
